## Description {#details}

This file defines the BumpPtrAllocator interface.

BumpPtrAllocator conforms to the LLVM &quot;Allocator&quot; concept and is similar to MallocAllocator, but objects cannot be deallocated. Their lifetime is tied to the lifetime of the allocator.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Allocate memory in an ever growing pool, as if by bump-pointer.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This isn&#39;t strictly a bump-pointer allocator as it uses backing slabs of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// memory rather than relying on a boundless contiguous heap. However, it has</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bump-pointer semantics in that it is a monotonically growing pool of memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// where every allocation is found by merely allocating the next N bytes in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the slab, or the next N bytes in the next slab.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that this also has a threshold for forcing allocations above a certain</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// size into their own slab.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The BumpPtrAllocatorImpl template defaults to using a MallocAllocator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// object, which wraps malloc, to allocate memory, but it can be changed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// use a custom allocator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The GrowthDelay specifies after how many allocated slabs the allocator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// increases the size of the slabs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AllocatorT = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mallocallocator">MallocAllocator</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SlabSize = 4096,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a977c94ac0ef5e305e5cf40726351d88a"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a977c94ac0ef5e305e5cf40726351d88a">Reset</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Deallocate all but the first slab, and deallocate all custom-sized slabs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Reset the state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">    CurPtr = (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;)Slabs.front();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">    End = CurPtr + SlabSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Allocate space at the specified alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This method is &#42;not&#42; marked noalias, because</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SpecificBumpPtrAllocator::DestroyAll() loops over all allocations, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that loop is not based on the Allocate() return value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Allocate(0, N) is valid, it returns a non-null pointer (which should not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be dereferenced).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a4054c3eefe873caf49c2290808d409ac"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#acbae7c06e77fa64145cca176963b6863">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NONNULL</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a4054c3eefe873caf49c2290808d409ac">Allocate</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Keep track of how many bytes we&#39;ve allocated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">    BytesAllocated += <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if LLVM&#95;ADDRESS&#95;SANITIZER&#95;BUILD</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">    uintptr&#95;t AllocEndPtr = AlignedPtr + SizeToAllocate;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AllocEndPtr &gt;= uintptr&#95;t(CurPtr) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if we have enough space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ae5b35beb6f127e5f47269e9124b886fb">LLVM&#95;LIKELY</a>(AllocEndPtr &lt;= uintptr&#95;t(End)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">      CurPtr = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(AllocEndPtr);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Update the allocation point of this memory block in MemorySanitizer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Without this, MemorySanitizer messages for values originated from here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#aef3aaf3bf7c0ec3ad8ad4941b14bb846"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#aef3aaf3bf7c0ec3ad8ad4941b14bb846">AllocateSlow</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SizeToAllocate, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If Size is really big, allocate a separate slab for it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PaddedSize = SizeToAllocate + Alignment.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align/#a80735739b49cf97a491922c8f9af2cc1">value</a>() - 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (PaddedSize &gt; SizeThreshold) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="normal">          this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/allocatorholder/#a3a804e12cb489b6d3d462de0f4455c08">getAllocator</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mallocallocator/#a46b47c18f94aa81e5205a7c67ff7daea">Allocate</a>(PaddedSize, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">alignof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(std::max&#95;align&#95;t));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We own the new slab and don&#39;t want anyone reading anyting other than</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a72741af87fe3babd5bb46653c26eff2a">&#95;&#95;asan&#95;poison&#95;memory&#95;region</a>(NewSlab, PaddedSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal">      CustomSizedSlabs.push&#95;back(std::make&#95;pair(NewSlab, PaddedSize));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">      uintptr&#95;t AlignedAddr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afff5074588f0423a669618a7134e13ec">alignAddr</a>(NewSlab, Alignment);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AlignedAddr + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> &lt;= (uintptr&#95;t)NewSlab + PaddedSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;AlignedPtr = (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#42;)AlignedAddr;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ad9e2781b72fd814787440ca2c3c0d6f0">&#95;&#95;msan&#95;allocated&#95;memory</a>(AlignedPtr, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a820fe7b3006fe7b31f19b0258993606a">&#95;&#95;asan&#95;unpoison&#95;memory&#95;region</a>(AlignedPtr, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AlignedPtr;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, start a new slab and try again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal">    StartNewSlab();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">    uintptr&#95;t AlignedAddr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afff5074588f0423a669618a7134e13ec">alignAddr</a>(CurPtr, Alignment);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AlignedAddr + SizeToAllocate &lt;= (uintptr&#95;t)End &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">           </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unable to allocate memory!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;AlignedPtr = (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#42;)AlignedAddr;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">    CurPtr = AlignedPtr + SizeToAllocate;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A wrapper around identifyKnownObject. Accepts type information</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// about the object and produces a smaller identifier by relying on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the alignment information. Note that sub-classes may have different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// alignment, so the most base class should be passed as template parameter</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in order to obtain correct results. For that reason automatic template</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// parameter deduction is disabled.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return An index uniquely and reproducibly identifying</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// an input pointer \\p Ptr in the given allocator. This identifier is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// different from the ones produced by identifyObject and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// identifyAlignedObject.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> T&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> computeSlabSize(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SlabIdx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Scale the actual allocated slab size based on the number of slabs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allocated. Every GrowthDelay slabs allocated, we double</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the allocated size to reduce allocation frequency, but saturate at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiplying the slab size by 2^30.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SlabSize &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">           ((size&#95;t)1 &lt;&lt; std::min&lt;size&#95;t&gt;(30, SlabIdx / GrowthDelay));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A BumpPtrAllocator that allows only elements of a specific type to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocated.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This allows calling the destructor in DestroyAll() and when the allocator is</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/specificbumpptrallocator"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> T&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/specificbumpptrallocator/#aa0b260cceae282bd1a0cb3976ba72c88">SpecificBumpPtrAllocator</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Because SpecificBumpPtrAllocator walks the memory to call destructors,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it can&#39;t have red zones between allocations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
